page.title: 08SOCIAL CONCERNS LOCALLY
page.content: Local farmers are worried about the Common Market flooding the country with food from other members and Britain not being able to get rid of its' surplus. Farmers in this area are worried about high machine costs and falling grain prices.Foreign competition like Danish Bacon and French Apples give cause for concern as do other cheap imports. Concern was expressed about the inner city unrest. They claim stubble burning does not pollute the atmosphere and are very worried about the prospect of nuclear war. Animal disease, especially that which can be spread by wildlife , and vetenary charges are always a worry as is the weather. If it is dry, a great deal of irrigation has to be done. Reductions of Government grants would also have a detrimental effect.
